meanings.definition: A ruler or monarch in certain Muslim countries.
meanings.sent1: The sultans of old had great power and wealth.
meanings.sent2: The sultans lived in grand palaces and ruled over vast lands.
meanings.sent3: The sultans decided to have a race to see who could ride their horses the fastest.
meanings.sent4: In the kingdom of imagination, the sultans of dreams reign supreme.
meanings.sent5: The sultans' golden crowns gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of their authority.

meanings.definition: A person exercising authority or control.
meanings.sent1: The strict teacher was the sultans of the classroom, enforcing rules with a firm hand.
meanings.sent2: She was the sultans of the household, making sure everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to be the sultans of the playground, deciding who could play on the swings.
meanings.sent4: His charisma made him the sultans of charm, effortlessly winning over everyone he met.
meanings.sent5: The CEO was the sultans of the company, making important decisions that affected all employees.
